function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limitation of not measuring viral aerosol particle size directly.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of viral aerosol behavior and effectiveness of UV-C disinfection.","Mitigation":"Utilize additional methods to assess viral aerosol particle size, such as microscopy or particle sizing instruments.","Technologies":"Microscopy, particle sizing instruments.","People":"Research scientists, environmental health professionals.","Owner":"Research institutions, health organizations."},{"Description":"Viral clumping and associations with suspended proteins may cause variability in viral particle size.","Impact":"Uncertainty in the behavior of viral aerosols and their susceptibility to UV-C disinfection.","Mitigation":"Conduct studies to understand the impact of viral clumping and protein associations on UV-C disinfection effectiveness.","Technologies":"Laboratory studies, epidemiological studies.","People":"Research scientists, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, government health agencies."},{"Description":"Adenovirus is the most resistant to 254 nm UV-C and requires high UV doses for complete inactivation.","Impact":"Incomplete inactivation of adenovirus in air disinfection processes, leading to potential disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Develop targeted UV-C exposure strategies for adenovirus in air disinfection systems.","Technologies":"UV-C exposure systems, dosage control technology.","People":"Industrial engineers, public health officials.","Owner":"Companies developing air disinfection technology, government health agencies."}]}
